data.text:
There is #OnlyOneEarth.

Protecting it is a global challenge & a global responsibility.

Find out from @UNEP how you can speak up for #ClimateAction -- on #WorldEnvironmentDay & every day: https://t.co/ChmzsSwAzS https://t.co/j4QseBGDkV

Millions of children have missed out on education & routine vaccines due to #COVID19.  

To be better protected against future pandemics, we need to improve primary healthcare. @UNICEF explains how 👇

https://t.co/l3FGLYzzpc

As voters & consumers we must make our actions count

We can all make environmentally friendly choices that will add up to the change we need.

-- @antonioguterres 

Learn how you can take #ClimateAction on Sunday's #WorldEnvironmentDay. https://t.co/TrmoKhFYEo

Sustainable fishing is needed to #SaveOurOcean & protect the livelihoods of millions of people.

On Sunday's Day of Illegal, Unreported & Unregulated Fishing, see how @FAO is helping to end this harmful practice. https://t.co/y09isb6Utb https://t.co/XtvHarzNX6

The science is clear. Time is running out.
We must go from harming our planet to healing it.
We need to rethink the way we live & the way we consume.

There is #OnlyOneEarth. 
We have to protect it.

@UNEP explains how on Sunday's #WorldEnvironmentDay:
https://t.co/jj8yX2dtul https://t.co/6P0sFasapm

There are billions of galaxies in the universe. 
There are billions of planets in our galaxy. 
But there is #OnlyOneEarth.

Together we can protect it. 

Get ideas how from @UNEP on Sunday's #WorldEnvironmentDay: https://t.co/ChmzsSwAzS https://t.co/P4wSjH54gk

When and how is a new @UNPeacekeeping operation formed?

The Security Council decides on new missions and their mandates. 

Get more details here: https://t.co/yS5VxBfWQR https://t.co/BWMxEncgIT

Children need peace & protection. They are #NotATarget. 

Saturday's International Day of Innocent Children Victims of Aggression affirms the UN's commitment to children's rights. https://t.co/L0bZnV7gDf https://t.co/SSbs9kbIE4

The impacts of the climate emergency also pose serious risks to psychosocial well-being - from emotional distress to anxiety & depression. 

@WHO is urging countries to include mental health support in their response to the climate crisis. https://t.co/CFZejDiLeV https://t.co/fEePqPlqrw

The ongoing war in Ukraine has been devastating for children, leaving 5+ million in need of humanitarian aid.

On Saturday's Int'l Day of Innocent Children Victims of Aggression, see how @UNICEF is providing life-saving support for the most vulnerable.

https://t.co/lxT6KQ0uqP

Media has a fundamental role to play to stop rape culture.

All of us can also help by changing the narrative that places blame on victims and by using the power of language in service of survivors, not perpetrators. 

More from @UN_Women: https://t.co/TELjf71enH https://t.co/ad3dUs89JI

100 days since the 24 February Russian invasion of Ukraine. 

100 days of shattered lives and senseless destruction. 

100 days too many.

The people of Ukraine need peace now.

https://t.co/Qn6PXFITmG via @Refugees https://t.co/Ti52p6pihL

Civilians and civilian infrastructure are #NotATarget. 

They must be protected. 

At all times.

Everywhere. https://t.co/JWQjjDeIZU

The Russian invasion of Ukraine has created a dire humanitarian crisis. 

The UN is helping with:

🔹protection & shelter for refugees
🔹support for children & families
🔹food & water
🔹healthcare & much more. 

See how you can stay informed & support:
https://t.co/cs4XHAuWY8 https://t.co/45kJbNW8JQ

From environment themed videogames to climate pop-ups, see how the gaming industry is helping engage audiences like never before to inspire a new wave of #ClimateAction.
https://t.co/hhPkBrQ4NQ

For more than 100 years, bicycles have helped advance women's rights by increasing their access to education, health care & sport. 

Friday is #WorldBicycleDay. https://t.co/4QSs2moNuR https://t.co/1xVUb8InmK

“Children will look for that positive aspect in whatever rubble they're living or playing in.”

-- @UNICEF Representative in Syria @bvnylund has dedicated his life to helping vulnerable children.

Find out what motivates him on Awake At Night: https://t.co/xdD1prUmib https://t.co/Hli4GKw3Sx

On Friday's #WorldBicycleDay & every day, the UN is supporting the use of bicycles to transform mobility, while also helping to create a greener, more sustainable future. https://t.co/4QSs2m7c6h https://t.co/SuzFkcfOZQ

"Our collective experience has shown that justice and accountability are fundamental to the pursuit of peace and security." 

-- @UNHumanRights chief @MBachelet briefing Security Council. https://t.co/SG2UNAFAVw

🚴‍♀️🚴‍♂️ Friday is #WorldBicycleDay! 

Learn more about the benefits of bikes, which are used around the world as simple, affordable & efficient modes of sustainable transport. https://t.co/dAaxqrC3XS #ClimateAction https://t.co/CJbqoXV8Sa

"Unless we act now, we will not have a livable planet."

At #Stockholm50, @antonioguterres stressed that we need to protect & nurture our planet if we want to survive & thrive. #ClimateAction https://t.co/PeRBO0YRiI https://t.co/khJp7DfV49

Ukraine: More than 250 children have been killed since the war began. 

5 million more remain at risk of violence & abuse.

@UNICEF is providing health, education & psychological support. https://t.co/KA9opcxlqV

 https://t.co/4qHqUKkNJY

Syria: After 11 years of conflict, more people are suffering than ever before.

14.6 million people need urgent humanitarian assistance & protection.

@UNOCHA works with partners to deliver life-saving aid, but more funds are needed.   

You can help: https://t.co/u2QfbW0Pqk https://t.co/TKAYdHjwll

"Today, I appeal to leaders in all sectors: Lead us out of this mess."

At #Stockholm50, @antonioguterres has called for urgent #ClimateAction & the realization of the human right to a clean, healthy environment for all people, everywhere. https://t.co/MjZ05Bi709 https://t.co/0LSbH3vQhb

A healthy ocean is vital for people & planet. 

Get ideas on how you can help #SaveOurOcean & our future: https://t.co/QtPJbVXpcf https://t.co/YBqSCFFsSO

The war in Ukraine has pushed nearly 1/3 of the country's population from their homes.

@UNDP is providing support through a digital platform that is helping to connect internally displaced people with critical public services. https://t.co/qEWBnX8HqY

LGBTIQ+ rights are HUMAN rights!

As #PrideMonth gets underway, join UN @free_equal and help ensure #LGBTIQ+ people can fully enjoy their human rights. https://t.co/Ljui9GqDYQ https://t.co/IGQOvijsce

On Thursday, #Stockholm50 gets underway in Sweden. 

The gathering represents a critical moment to inspire urgent #ClimateAction for people & planet to create a healthy, prosperous future for all.

Here's what you can expect. ⬇️
https://t.co/zQZG7E1Q2x

✔️Believe survivors. 
❌Don’t excuse perpetrators. 
❌Don’t joke about gender-based violence.

We can all take small actions that can have a big impact when it comes to ending violence against women. https://t.co/TELjf6JCZ7 via @UN_Women https://t.co/jJWv1OMRvw

Ukraine: At least two children have been killed daily, with many more injured since the Russian invasion.

Without an urgent ceasefire, children will continue to suffer, says @UNICEF.

Children need safety & stability, but most importantly they need peace. https://t.co/XEiSGb8x9z

The number of people living without electricity is declining. 

Yet, at the current pace, 670 million people will still lack access by 2030. 

The #GlobalGoals seek to ensure affordable, clean energy is available for all. https://t.co/mxINk6XGsJ #TrackingSDG7 https://t.co/biji5Vxxx7

Democratic Republic of the Congo: Resurgence of M23 armed group is forcing thousands from their homes & constitutes a serious threat to peace & security in the region, top UN official warns Security Council, urging action to tackle violence. https://t.co/1LWxRyqZdr

From active listening to explaining feelings, interacting effectively with children is key for their emotional development. 

On Wednesday's Global Day of Parents, @UNICEF shares tips on how to build a safe & supportive relationship with your child. 

https://t.co/4v6eVcSUnG

Education is a human right and everyone has the right to access a quality education. 

@UN_Women works for gender equality and the empowerment of girls & women around the world. https://t.co/9DkJpsP6x9 https://t.co/gNslvp7bh7

Albania assumes the presidency of the Security Council for the month of June.

Follow @AlMissionUN for updates. https://t.co/utS4x92dvU https://t.co/xnKWuBTUMw

Wednesday is the Global Day of Parents. 

As families have borne the brunt of the #COVID19 pandemic and other crises, family-friendly workplace practices & stronger childcare policies are needed more than ever. https://t.co/klRzCVBpQx https://t.co/8FNxgkWphG

The ocean is the planet’s largest ecosystem, regulating the climate & providing livelihoods for billions. Yet, it faces several threats.

The UN Ocean Conference in Portugal in June is set to be a critical moment to #SaveOurOcean. https://t.co/0dWbdGGGLh

The tobacco epidemic is one of the world's largest, yet preventable, public health threats, resulting in more than 8 million deaths a year. 

Tuesday is World #NoTobacco Day🚭.

More from @WHO: https://t.co/BPcIJA5zjN https://t.co/XuZxVF2sJB

The tobacco industry is one of the world’s worst polluters, causing:
♦️ deforestation
♦️ air pollution
♦️ water waste
♦️ littered beaches & much more damage

More from @WHO on Tuesday's World  #NoTobacco Day: https://t.co/xOe3h5EdOB https://t.co/2YG3WSCaMM

Despite strong global growth in internet use, 2.9 billion people are still offline.

The #GenerationConnect Global Youth Summit aims to promote young people's perspectives for a better, inclusive digital future for all: https://t.co/OB6cSdIXPS https://t.co/RO7Klis8QW

Tuesday is World #NoTobacco Day🚭.

Stop the tobacco industry from poisoning our health and our planet. 

More from @UNEP & @WHO: https://t.co/q7tDc18nih #TobaccoExposed. https://t.co/vNvbjnMHRs

Prioritizing mental health is important during times of high stress.

As #MentalHealthAwarenessMonth comes to an end, @WHO shares tips to look after your mental health & help others who may need extra support:
https://t.co/5fnexdHZoj https://t.co/pOthNOqoJ3

Every year, more than 8 million people die from tobacco.

There is no better time to commit to quit!

More from @WHO on Tuesday's World #NoTobacco Day. https://t.co/xOe3h5VPdb https://t.co/HM4pZYy2MS

All people are born with the same universal rights & should be afforded equal opportunities.

We all have a role to play in ensuring a more inclusive future for all. 

@UN_Women has 7 ways we can take action to create #GenerationEquality. 
https://t.co/DZU8j7oIDD

Wherever they may come from, stand #WithRefugees.💙

Here's how you can support @Refugees https://t.co/XiWUtNmuDE https://t.co/T9SyW4vtdb

The #GlobalGoals are our blueprint to achieve a better & more sustainable world.

Learn more about the 17 Goals created to transform our future. https://t.co/Ss4uMcXdcV https://t.co/UcDoiwlxK0

Nearly 1 billion people have no official proof of identity, which prevents them from accessing key services & excludes them from parts of society.

@UNDP has digital solutions for closing the identity gap. https://t.co/xag6vgaux9

Many young people are struggling with their mental well-being, especially amid #COVID19. 

@UNICEF has tips for parents & caregivers on how to start important conversations with young people about their mental health. https://t.co/5c9Ziys3Pb #OnMyMind https://t.co/AjTKWWejIi

What we share online can have consequences in the real world.

Misinformation can result in people being left uninformed & can put lives at risk during a crisis.

#PledgeToPause and verify facts before sharing. https://t.co/qFqoh7CZOA https://t.co/pk7l08QXlr

Sunday is Int'l Day of UN Peacekeepers! 

87,000+ men & women are #ServingForPeace in 12 peacekeeping missions worldwide to:

🇺🇳 Protect civilians
🇺🇳 Help achieve & maintain peace
🇺🇳 Defend human rights & much more

We thank them for their service!

https://t.co/fOO1anhAJf #PKDay https://t.co/E4eXIZP9XJ

Nearly 1 in 10 women globally are living in extreme poverty, and inadequate social protections are increasing the vulnerability of women & girls around the world.

More facts on poverty & the #GlobalGoals: https://t.co/AeUI1G4J7U https://t.co/ln9AHbDQLi

Despite grave personal risks, the men & women #ServingForPeace with @UNPeacekeeping are helping to create a more peaceful & prosperous world.

On Sunday's International Day of UN Peacekeepers, & every day, we thank them for their service! https://t.co/USPjbF4FUz #PKDay https://t.co/MDoh6BZDpU

Racism, xenophobia & intolerance harm everyone.

But each of us can exercise our rights & help #FightRacism:
🏘 Join community organizations
🗳 Vote
✍️ Sign petitions
🪧 Join peaceful protests

More ideas on how to #FightRacism: https://t.co/cCd3JjLrsV https://t.co/PGRp1RCuiH

Partnerships are essential to secure peace, advance progress & promote prosperity. 

On Sunday's #PK Day, learn how the women & men #ServingForPeace with @UNPeacekeeping are harnessing the power of partnerships to create a better world for all. https://t.co/gQ7NxQaWRC https://t.co/ZjAogQdDiy

The number of people suffering from obesity has nearly tripled since 1975. 

🧁limit fats & sugars
🥦increase fruit & vegetables
🏃exercise regularly

@WHO has more tips on reducing the risk of obesity on Sunday's World Digestive Health Day. https://t.co/swRmMNbOes https://t.co/aYXbgmwhVf

Successful peacekeeping requires close cooperation with communities, civil society, young people & others.

Learn more about the power of @UNPeacekeeping's partnerships on Sunday's #PKDay. https://t.co/gQ7NxQsygc https://t.co/iTbFtoJdGP

“Children will look for that positive aspect in whatever rubble they're living or playing in.”

-- @UNICEF Representative in Syria @bvnylund dedicated his life to helping vulnerable children.

Find out what motivates him on Awake At Night: https://t.co/o2pQ9TET8i

Periods are just as natural as breathing, and an essential part of human biology.

Saturday is #MenstrualHygieneDay. https://t.co/ZcNBKqQRrm via @UNFPA https://t.co/pGk7NbTLmC

Now is the time for an investment surge in renewable energy to create jobs, save money & lives.

#ClimateAction is not only the right thing to do. 
It's also the smart thing to do. 
https://t.co/No9mpoAWoP https://t.co/kXzooB81Vg

Menstrual health is a human right, and periods are a normal part of human biology. 

Yet, menstruation can result in discrimination & exclusion.

On Saturday's #MenstrualHygieneDay, let's end the stigma around menstruation. Period. https://t.co/ZcNBKr8sPW via @UNFPA https://t.co/VIdUs2mB8Y

"Promoting gender equality promotes equal & full participation of both men & women."

Meet Major Winnet Zharare of Zimbabwe, recipient of the 2021 UN Military Gender Advocate of the Year Award. https://t.co/d2FpQdLcB5 https://t.co/kXsvVonhZY

Let's end the stigma around menstruation. Period. 

On Saturday's #MenstrualHygieneDay & every day, @UN_Women works to safeguard the health of women & girls without stress, shame or unnecessary barriers to information or menstrual supplies. https://t.co/wDyrYeo3wz https://t.co/7VhW6p87Ua

Countries must take immediate steps to protect against the climate crisis & other catastrophes.

As UN conference on disaster risk reduction comes to a close, participants emphasize the importance of resilience & effective early warning systems. https://t.co/O1ueSfjWsd

100 million people have been forced to flee their homes due to violence, persecution & abuse.

Seeking asylum is a fundamental human right; for everyone, everywhere. https://t.co/rtosk22X9s via @Refugees

 https://t.co/XeGgKdmIVN

📷: The father of late UN peacekeeper Captain Abdelrazakh of Chad was presented the Captain Diagne Medal for Exceptional Courage by @antonioguterres this week.

The tribute is @UNPeacekeeping's highest honour for bravery. https://t.co/fevFiNPiMp #ServingForPeace https://t.co/efjJQBXENe

Civilians and civilian infrastructure are #NotATarget. 

They must be protected. 

At all times.

More from @UNOCHA as Protection of Civilians Week ends: https://t.co/Z5prF2IKec https://t.co/YonNmkfern

Words can be weapons, leading to devastating consequences in real life. 

💭 Think critically. 
📚 Check facts.
📱 Click wisely.

More tips on how you can say #NoToHate: https://t.co/LiLrhbvu01 https://t.co/dCdk7VV3V4

Our peacekeepers work tirelessly in the toughest of conditions. 

They constantly innovate to protect the most vulnerable.

They advance the greatest mission of all — peace.

-- @antonioguterres ahead of #PKDay. https://t.co/XO3ueKQHgM

Syria: UN commission says that shutting down humanitarian border crossing point would be unconscionable.

14.6 million Syrians are currently dependent on assistance, the highest number recorded since the start of war. https://t.co/Z8hfqoVmPs

“It is my fervent belief that gender equality creates a fair society. Without equal opportunities for men & women, there is no fairness.”

-- Major Winnet Zharare of Zimbabwe receives the 2021 UN Military Gender Advocate of the Year Award. https://t.co/d2FpQdLcB5 https://t.co/uj8k5l4X1Q

Racism, discrimination and xenophobia harm us all.

But everyone, everywhere can take action to spread compassion, tolerance and acceptance.

Get ideas about how YOU can help #FightRacism. https://t.co/cCd3JjLrsV https://t.co/YgJZY3IUuU

Whether it's responding to conflict, #COVID19 or the climate crisis, @UNICEF is working to protect children's rights everywhere. 

You can help them respond to the acute needs of children and their families in need around the world: https://t.co/TbMmaqqw8P

In Uganda, @WFP is providing assistance to 20,000+ refugees who have fled violence in Democratic Republic of Congo.

An additional USD 69 million is needed to ensure adequate nutrition, shelter & other necessities. https://t.co/klKknDeqyc https://t.co/hP5cOhtIVk

Armed conflict is exacerbating human suffering. 

Hospitals are #NotATarget.

Health care workers are #NotATarget. 

Schools are #NotATarget. 

Children are #NotATarget. 

Humanitarians are #NotATarget.

It is Protection of Civilians Week: https://t.co/Z5prF30l5K https://t.co/LLHGoMN40E

To achieve the #GlobalGoals, UN teams around the world continue to support countries as they recover from #COVID19, while also scaling up resources to leave no one behind.

Latest on their efforts: https://t.co/0lc5dE6o6A via @UN_SDG

The @UNAOC fellowship is an intercultural exchange for young professionals aiming to challenge perceptions & deconstruct stereotypes. 

This year's theme focuses on countering discrimination & racism to build inclusive societies. 

Apply now: https://t.co/j14YPUUtjH https://t.co/5SGYQFYutw
Conflict continues to inflict widespread civilian death and injury, senior UN official tells Security Council, outlining grim reality for those caught up in crossfire of war. https://t.co/pJ3m8Czcxy

“We can – and we must – put our efforts firmly behind prevention & risk reduction & build a safe, sustainable, resilient & equitable future for all.”

— @AminaJMohammed at closing of disaster risk reduction conference. https://t.co/ve2yejzGZ6

Words can be weapons; leading to devastating consequences in real life. 

From checking facts to sharing messages of tolerance, get tips on how you can say #NoToHate: https://t.co/LiLrhbvu01 https://t.co/1VcKDrxhus

More than 1 million women & men from around the world have served in 70+ @UNPeacekeeping missions since 1948.

Find out more about their important work #ServingForPeace ahead of Sunday's #PKDay: https://t.co/2ZO2zN8aq6 https://t.co/t2IMAg2wia

Mary-Ellen McGroarty, @WFP Country Chief in Afghanistan, shares her concerns about the ongoing humanitarian crisis in the country and the traumatic impact on women & girls in the latest episode of our podcast Awake At Night with @MelissaFleming. https://t.co/PZqTPqXUr3 https://t.co/ufgZIRH7mx

Wednesday is #AfricaDay! 

Check out @africarenewal for the latest information & analysis of major economic and development challenges facing Africa today: https://t.co/2cxagAYSLk https://t.co/yS9kbIQ5Ig

Since the creation of the UN in 1945, 80+ former colonies have gained independence. 

The International Week of Solidarity with Peoples of Non-Self-Governing Territories starts on Wednesday: https://t.co/nomsytWFJi https://t.co/e2AOwChL1J

Wednesday is #AfricaDay! 

Help us celebrate Africa's diversity by sharing a picture that represents your heritage or connection to the continent & encouraging friends to do the same! 

https://t.co/2cxagBgu9U via @africarenewal https://t.co/xOr3UyRMA0

Despite the #COVID19 pandemic, ongoing conflict & economic crises, @UNRWA continues delivering primary care to millions of Palestine refugees in Jordan, Lebanon, Syria, the West Bank & Gaza. https://t.co/Sfo7r6n46B https://t.co/bC2QZXNtG9

Every child has the right to grow up free from fear.

School should be a place where children feel safe and supported. 

#EndViolence in schools now. 

via @UNICEF 
https://t.co/ADuC9RS9zt

The Knotted Gun sculpture at UN Headquarters in New York is a universal symbol of non-violence. 

Today, people around the world continue to connect to this cherished sculpture and its powerful message of peace and hope. https://t.co/QibPJZBhNM

The monkeypox outbreak reported in 16 countries can still be contained, @WHO stresses.

Health experts say that although the disease can affect anyone & is not unique to any particular group, the overall risk of transmission is low. https://t.co/8CcUA4a6L4 https://t.co/XEuNKuvEvf

"My message to you is simple: 
Don’t work for climate-wreckers. 
Use your talents to drive us towards a renewable future."

-- @antonioguterres tells @SetonHall graduates theirs must be the generation that succeeds in addressing the climate emergency. https://t.co/WoniDMj4dm https://t.co/63S8Da2uzT

Rising food & fuel prices & financial turbulence have destabilised the global job market, says @ILO.

The war in Ukraine, #COVID19, supply chain disruptions & multiple other crises are derailing the recovery of the labour market & increasing inequalities. https://t.co/ZA4XtSwP0Z

Monkeypox: As more cases of the disease are confirmed around the world, @UNAIDS warns that stigma & blame will undermine trust and hinder an effective response to the outbreak. https://t.co/IDRLTdfdFJ

For 20+ years, Mary-Ellen McGroarty has worked for the UN in some of the world's most dangerous places.

Currently, she's head of @WFP in Afghanistan.

Listen to her inspiring story in the latest episode of our Awake At Night podcast with @MelissaFleming: https://t.co/qrdtOL4xRp https://t.co/uWtIYvh9s0

"We have a critical opportunity to build consensus on how digital technologies can be used for the good of people and the planet, while addressing their risks."

-- UN political chief @DicarloRosemary to Security Council. https://t.co/PPbfRtFqBC
